The Name of the column. Usually the value of the first row in the column.
A human readable Title for the column.
A Description of the column
Choose a Type for the data in the column
Choose the Format for the Type of data
Set a RDF Type to provide extra meaning to the Type
Set a Constraint to limit valid values
Value(s) that indicate a Missing Value. Separate values with a comma.
The Nameof the Table. Lower case, numbers, ".", "_", "-" characters only
The Title or one sentence description for this Table
A Description for the Table
The Sources for the data in this Table. Each Source MUST have a title and MAY have path and/or email address.
The Open License under which the Table is provided
Select the CSV Dialect for the Table
Select the column(s) that are the Primary Key that uniquely identifies each row in the table.
Select the table to reference for the Foreign Key
Select the column(s) that make up the Foreign Key Table
The Name of the Data Package. Lower case, numbers, ".", "_", "-" characters only
A globally unique identifier (Id) e.g. a UUID or DOI
The Open License under which the Data Package is provided
A Title or one sentence description for this Data Package
The first paragraph of the Description should be usable as summary information for the package. Markdown formatting allowed.
The Home Page
The Version of the data package. It should conform to the [Data Package Version Pattern](http://specs.frictionlessdata.io/patterns/#data-package-version).
A list of Sources for this Data Package. Each Source MUST have a title and MAY have path and/or email address.
A list of Contributors (people or organisations) who contributed to this Data Package
A list of Keywords to assist users searching for the package in catalogs
The URL of an Image to use for this Data Package.
